io.janusproject.kernel.services.jdk.distributeddata

Class StandardDistributedDataStructureService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractService
      • io.janusproject.services.AbstractDependentService
        • io.janusproject.kernel.services.jdk.distributeddata.StandardDistributedDataStructureService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Service, DependentService, DistributedDataStructureService

    public class StandardDistributedDataStructureService
extends AbstractDependentService
implements DistributedDataStructureService
    Service providing tools for creating distributed data structures. This implementation creates standard Java collections that cannot be distributed other several JVM.
    Version:
    2.0.2.0 2015-04-09 09:04:05
    Author:
    Stéphane Galland
    Maven Group Id:
    io.janusproject
    Maven Artifact Id:
    io.janusproject.kernel

      • getMap

        public <K,V> DMap<K,V> getMap(String name)
        Description copied from interface: DistributedDataStructureService
        Replies the DMap with the given name. This function permits to create a map for keys without a natural order, and without a specific comparator. An object has a natural order if it implements Comparable. This function is equivalent to create a HashMap in the standard Java API. If the keys have a natural order, i.e. they implement the Comparable interface, or if you are able to provide a Comparator, then it is recommended to use DistributedDataStructureService.getMap(String, Comparator) in place of the function DistributedDataStructureService.getMap(String).
        Specified by:
        getMap in interface DistributedDataStructureService
        Type Parameters:
        K - - types of the keys in the map.
        V - - types of the values in the map.
        Parameters:
        name - - name of the shared map.
        Returns:
        the map.
        See Also:
        DistributedDataStructureService.getMap(String, Comparator)

      • getMap

        public <K,V> DMap<K,V> getMap(String name,
                     Comparator<? super K> comparator)
        Description copied from interface: DistributedDataStructureService
        Replies the DMap with the given name. This function permits to create a map for keys with a natural order, OR with a specific comparator. An object has a natural order if it implements Comparable. If the comparator is null, then the natural order of the keys is used. This function is equivalent to create a TreeMap in the standard Java API. If the keys have not a natural order, i.e. they not implement the Comparable interface, or if you are not able to provide a Comparator, then it is recommended to use DistributedDataStructureService.getMap(String) in place of the function DistributedDataStructureService.getMap(String, Comparator).
        Specified by:
        getMap in interface DistributedDataStructureService
        Type Parameters:
        K - - types of the keys in the map.
        V - - types of the values in the map.
        Parameters:
        name - - name of the shared map.
        comparator - - the comparator of the keys.
        Returns:
        the map.
        See Also:
        DistributedDataStructureService.getMap(String)

      • getMultiMap

        public <K,V> DMultiMap<K,V> getMultiMap(String name)
        Description copied from interface: DistributedDataStructureService
        Replies the DMultiMap with the given name. This function permits to create a map for keys without a natural order, and without a specific comparator. An object has a natural order if it implements Comparable. This function is equivalent to create a HashMap in the standard Java API. If the keys have a natural order, i.e. they implement the Comparable interface, or if you are able to provide a Comparator, then it is recommended to use DistributedDataStructureService.getMultiMap(String, Comparator) in place of the function DistributedDataStructureService.getMultiMap(String).
        Specified by:
        getMultiMap in interface DistributedDataStructureService
        Type Parameters:
        K - - types of the keys in the map.
        V - - types of the values in the map.
        Parameters:
        name - - name of the shared multi-map.
        Returns:

      • getMultiMap

        public <K,V> DMultiMap<K,V> getMultiMap(String name,
                               Comparator<? super K> comparator)
        Description copied from interface: DistributedDataStructureService
        Replies the DMultiMap with the given name. This function permits to create a map for keys with a natural order, OR with a specific comparator. An object has a natural order if it implements Comparable. If the comparator is null, then the natural order of the keys is used. This function is equivalent to create a TreeMap in the standard Java API. If the keys have not a natural order, i.e. they not implement the Comparable interface, or if you are not able to provide a Comparator, then it is recommended to use DistributedDataStructureService.getMultiMap(String) in place of the function DistributedDataStructureService.getMultiMap(String, Comparator).
        Specified by:
        getMultiMap in interface DistributedDataStructureService
        Type Parameters:
        K - - types of the keys in the map.
        V - - types of the values in the map.
        Parameters:
        name - - name of the shared multi-map.
        comparator - - the comparator of the keys.
        Returns:
        the map.
        See Also:
        DistributedDataStructureService.getMultiMap(String)
